literal_meaning: To have a cat in a sack.
figurative_meaning: To make a risky purchase without knowing what you are getting.
example: Buying that old car is like having a cat in a sack; you don't know what you're really getting.

figurative_meaning: To come unexpectedly or out of nowhere.
example: His promotion seemed to fall from the sky; no one saw it coming.

figurative_meaning: Those who are satisfied do not complain about their situation.
example: He has everything he needs; siti se ne pritožujejo.

figurative_meaning: In the end, only the strong will endure.
example: Despite all the challenges, remember: voda nosi, kamen ostane.

idiom: Niti muha ne more priti skozi
literal_meaning: Not even a fly can get through.
figurative_meaning: Very strict or tightly controlled situation.
example: The security at that event was so tight that niti muha ne more priti skozi.

figurative_meaning: To be very full or satisfied after eating.
example: After that feast, I am siti kot žaba.

figurative_meaning: To be in a good position or to have an advantage.
example: With this new job, I feel like I'm biti na konju.

literal_meaning: To have eyes like an owl.
figurative_meaning: To be very observant or perceptive.
example: She has eyes like sove; she notices everything around her.

figurative_meaning: To let things go or to relax about a situation.
example: Sometimes you just have to pustiti vodo and not worry too much about it.
